description: Ability to bathe oneself including getting in/out of tub or shower
independence_criteria: Receives no assistance (gets in and out of tub by self if tub is usual means of bathing), or receives assistance in bathing only a single part of the body
dependence_indicators: Receives assistance in bathing more than one part of the body, or requires complete bathing assistance
clinical_significance: First ADL to decline in dementia progression

description: Ability to get clothes and dress oneself
independence_criteria: Gets clothes from closets and drawers, puts on clothes including undergarments and outer garments, manages fasteners (zippers, buttons, snaps)
dependence_indicators: Receives assistance in getting clothes or in getting dressed, or stays partly or completely undressed
clinical_significance: Requires complex motor planning and sequencing

description: Ability to use toilet including getting to/from toilet and managing clothing
independence_criteria: Goes to toilet room, cleans self after elimination, and arranges clothes without assistance (may use walker/cane or wheelchair and may manage bedpan or commode at night)
dependence_indicators: Receives assistance in going to toilet room, cleaning self, arranging clothes after elimination, or uses bedpan or commode with assistance
clinical_significance: Loss impacts dignity and requires intimate care assistance

description: Ability to move in and out of bed and chair
independence_criteria: Moves in and out of bed as well as in and out of chair without assistance (may use cane or walker for support)
dependence_indicators: Receives assistance in moving in and out of bed or chair, or does not get out of bed
clinical_significance: Critical for mobility and fall risk assessment

description: Control over urinary and bowel functions
independence_criteria: Controls urination and bowel movement completely by self without accidents
dependence_indicators: Supervision required with urination or bowel movement, uses catheter, or is incontinent of urine or feces
icf_category: Activities and Participation - Self-care / Body Functions
clinical_significance: Significant impact on caregiver burden and skin integrity

independence_criteria: Feeds self without assistance, able to use utensils to get food from plate into mouth
dependence_indicators: Receives assistance in feeding or is fed partly or completely by using tubes or intravenous fluids
clinical_significance: Last ADL to decline; loss indicates severe impairment

adl_id: # Scale: Katz Index of Independence in Activities of Daily Living

dependence_indicators: Jaffe MW. Studies of illness in the aged: The index of ADL. JAMA. 1963;185(12):914-919.

adl_id: # Clinical Use: Widely used in geriatric assessment
# Validity: Strong correlation with cognitive decline and care needs
# Typical Decline Pattern in Dementia: Bathing → Dressing → Toileting → Transferring → Continence → Feeding
# Assessment Frequency: Every 3-6 months in dementia care
# Usage for WP-02: These 6 ADLs will be mapped to FAST stages to determine which ADLs are impaired at each stage
